intro: Jonquilla parvicorona, commonly known as the dwarf golden crocus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous structure and delicate, early spring blooms. The plant produces small, cup-shaped flowers that are typically bright yellow or orange in color. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, often growing in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
